source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: The principal use for zirconium alloys is as a structural material in lightwater reactors.

source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: Most of the research conducted in recent years (after 1970) has been to better define the properties of the three primary alloys, Zircaloy-2, Zircaloy-4, and Zr-2.5Nb.

source_id: STP824-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_6th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: The complexity of the extractive metallurgy of zirconium is illustrated by the fact that the process presently used to produce double-melted reactorgrade Zircaloy ingots, starting from zircon sand, involves some 23 steps and 17 different types of unit operations.
